content:
Posted: November 2, 2015
												After a couple of hours of playing this title, I'm convinced that it deserves a place in the Arcade Racer Hall of Fame.  This is a little known gem, and well worth the purchase.  I'd rank it up there with DiRT Showdown, Flatout: Ultimate Carnage and other first rate arcade racers.The graphics are great, it supports my Fanatec Porsche GT3 RSR v2 wheel and pedals, the humor is hilarious low brow and I even like the sound track music, which is a rare thing for me.I haven't had any problems, it runs fine with all the eye candy maxed out on my AMD 1090T 3.2 GHz 6-core, ATI Radeon R9 280X DC2 TOP, 16 GB DDR3 RAM machine.  Silky smooth framerates.They've done a great job with this one and it definitely deserves some attention.  I spend most of my time with hardcore racing simulations, but now and then I like to leave off the realistic stuff and go crazy with a good arcade racer,  This one fills the bill nicely.Highly recommended.

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 6, 2015
												This genre is scarce on pc. This game's a bit too demanding on hardware. it takes a bit too much firepower to take down an opponent. Making it feel a fraction too grindy. Luckily the driving and speed feel solid, car combat games often miss the sense of speed so they can focus on the combat. This manages to feel fast. Although not burnout fast unfortunately. Other than health bars being too long, the combat feels passable. Good once you start using better weapons.Overall I'd say this game is far better than a cheap indie title, and is one of the better car combat games on the pc. Full stop. I look forward to what the developers of this do next. My advice would be to make a game with the same passion and involvement, and make it a little bit more of a burnout with rockets feeling game. A cross between split second, burnout 3, and twisted metal. To me this is too much twisted metal and not enough burnout. Although everyones taste is subjective. 8/10 - Good game.

content:
Posted: February 19, 2015
												Very fun combat racing game. In single player you earn money by completing different race types including power race (no weapons other than traps like mines and oil slicks), combat races (full use of weaponry including machine guns, rocket launchers, etc.), and other arena-based competitions like capture the flag and deathmatch. I haven't tried the multiplayer yet.I'm not really sure how single player progression works. I got few the first few races and was invited to a tournanment, which I won. After that I was told that I had been entered into a new skill bracket, but I'm still racing all the same opponents on the same courses. I haven't even unlocked a new car for sale in quite a while.I had hoped that the game would give you more control over the visuals of your car, such as providing options for spoilers, hoods, sideskirts, etc. However, all you can customize are the paintjob and sticker (not even those if your car is sponsored - they choose the graphics for you) and some under-the-hood stuff like engine and brake upgrades.

content:
Posted: October 15, 2015
												I'm not a big fan of racing games usually, but this game is fantastic. Reminds me of the old Twisted Metal games for Playstation. It's a solid racing game but with tons of action, explosions, and even zombies. I was just going to play it for a little bit to kill some time, and I ended up getting hooked on it.The positives are the gameplay, difficulty, and visuals. The game is exciting, with guns and explosions and a few jumps. Quite satisfying. The game can get very difficult on the higher difficulty settings, which provides a great challenge. The visuals are probably the strongest aspect of this game. Very gritty, but at the same time flashy and over-the-top. Overall, it's a very gratifying experience.The downside is that there is pretty much no choice at all in terms of cars and equipment. Each new car is basically a complete upgrade of the previous car, so there's no strategy or preference at all. The best car is just the best car for everything. All upgrades can be bought, and there's no need to design anything. You just choose the best car with all upgrades, and that's the best. Would be nice to see slower heavy cars that are better for battle, or super fast cars that get wrecked easily.

content:
Posted: December 12, 2014
												So far, I have truly enjoyed this game.  It's pretty basic, cars with guns.  You drive, you race, you destroy.  The usual.  It's set up such that every race, you get points.  You use those points to try to climb up the leader board.  You can buy cars, upgrade them, customize them with stickers and such you earn by winning.  There's some interesting gameplay modes, including team death match and the like.  That, along with the Duke Nukem styled voice (one of the options for your character's in-game voice as you race), makes me really think back to Death Rally with this game (the original, not the remake).  There's no deep, multi-faceted story to uncover here, but there doesn't need to be.  What it does it does well, and I have a lot of fun with it.

number of helpful: 3 of 5 people (60%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 23, 2014
												Gas Guzzlers Extreme is a driving game with guns. It is a basic concept but works well enough to be fun and addictive. Some player may get bored with the basic concept but for those player who don't have much experience with car battle games. Then this will fill the void nicely. There is lots of upgrades, tracks & weapons to unlock as you progress through the career mode. There are three main features to customise your cars with, colour, sticker and rims. Getting through the career mode does take a bit of time and luck. It does not necessarily matter how good your are but it will help.Controls of the cars feel realistic enough. They feel heavy and planted to the ground. The control input is very responsive.The graphics are very good depending on the performance of your computer. There is an issue with frame rate dropping when in the middle of a pack of cars and going at high speed. I believes from other players that this issue does appear whatever graphic performance setup you have. So this maybe a terminal issue in the game. However the frame rate does not drop enough to spoil the game. It will take a little practice to adjust your judgement when this occurs.Sound of the cars are realistic and make controlling them feel real. Firing the weapons sound good on release and impact. The sound track of the game I am really impressed with. It sets the mood of the game just right. I only play the soundtrack during the menus. Listening to the carnage in the game play sounds just as good and feels satisfying.Highly recommend this game. There are several game play modes available offline and online.

content:
Posted: May 3, 2015
												I'm not a fan of arcade racers.  The last one I played for any length of time was Gran Turismo on the PS1.  So you can imagine it takes a lot for me to drag out the thumb controller, but this game did it.  I bought it because I'm an old Car Wars player, (I still have the ziplock bag version that I purchased new in 1980), but what keeps me playing Gas Guzzlers is the fact that it's more fun than a guy should be allowed to have with his pants on.  It's not something you'll spend any marathon gaming sessions playing, mind you, but it's a great little 30 minute-per-evening game.  After commuting home from work, running other cars off the road or sticking a rocket up their tailpipe is just what the doctor ordered.One other note:  the guy who did the music in the garage should get an award.  It's absolutely awesome.  I've not heard the same thing twice.  Johnny Cash, 20s flapper songs, gospel, Laurel and Hardy, hell there's even a soccer match in Spanish.  Top notch.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 26, 2015
												I didnt have big hopes for this game as most games bought today are more of the same stuff with different cars and tracks. Nothing bad about that but no new wooov experience. Anywy back to this game, short story.  2 Words: Mad Max and Death Race on steroids :)Depending on what type of race you choose you will be able to upgrade parts such as engine, brakes, tires and more. And if not satisfied buy yourself a new unlocked car. And the cosmetic yup its here as well. Paint your car, put on bought stripes, paintbrush stickers and why not some new shiny rimes  ;) The car handling and physix is spot on in this game. Love it. The feeling when you accelrate feels down to your bones.Campaign: Choose your car and upgrade it with the money you have in the begining. (Dont worrie you will earn alot more as you progress and unlock more stuff.) After that you are being showed a screen where you can pick your favourite type of race. You will progress in a leaderboard up to the top. And you will unlock more cars, parts, stripes, wepons and more depending how you beat the maps placing 1st,2nd or 3rd place. In campaign you will also get sponsor contracts where you can earn some big cash and drive their sponsored car. You can also unlock sponsor car skins wich will give you some extra cash if you use them and win any race.Quickrace: Here you can choose Car combat, Normal race, Destruction derby, Last man standing or why not zombie mode one hell of fun if you ask me. Take some friends with you for a game and you will have a blast. Iam getting this for my son thats for sure. Love it. (There are more gamemodes in the game, the above is an example.) One last thing quickrace is awesome for killing some time. In my case i have been playing quickrace destruction derby, defend base and survivor zombies for hours already. ;)Multiplayer: Is the same pure fun as singleplayer but with real people online ;)Gfx 10-10 (The quality of textures, animations and physix's is midblowing)SFx 9-10 (Sfx and music is fitting the game perfectly)Gameplay 10-10 (The car handling is one of the best i have experienced in the arcade genre)I have been trying to look for some flaws but couldnt find anything wrong with this game. My new gem in my collection for sure. I would recommend developer to have this game as free weekend, i can promise that most of all new players who didnt have a clue about this game will buy it. RECOMMENDED FOR SURE!Please note! That zombie mode is bought as DLC and i would recommend buying all DLC. Worth every £ $ €  ;)

Posted: April 27, 2015
												Great game and lots of fun and challenges , only one complaint the graphics power its using does not equate to the performance  I see rendered ... Ive got some other games with as good graphics that demand far less from my system .. the exchange doesnt make any sense at all ... basicaly if you have a medium graphics card you are going to struggle with this at good settings. update // recently purchased a gtx 750 ti  card ... its  entry level in the high range of  cards and cost me only  $200 (you can probably get it cheaper but I was in a hurry) ... this game runs flawlessly in max settings ... frame rates between 50 -60  everything maxed out.   Definatley buy this game if you have a decent card ... one of the most fun games I own from steam , I love it !

content:
Posted: July 14, 2015
												This game brings the type of enjoyment I used to get out of old games like San Francisco Rush 2049!The racing is fun, the graphics are great (especially in 3D Vision), the performance is amazing (4K via DSR in 3D Vision with everything maxed and AA most of the way up), vehicle handling works well, the damage system adds a sense of risk while providing humor (such as drivers trapped in trunks being revealed once the doors are ripped off), the battles add even more fun, and all the extra game modes complete the awesome experience!Absolutely great game for those who like racing with weapons and explosions!System Specs:Case: NZXT Phantom 001BKCPU: Intel i7 3970XMOBO: ASUS Rampage IV Extreme x79RAM: 32GB 1600 DDR3 4x8GB (Quad channel)GPU: EVGA GTX 780 Classified w/ ACX coolerSound Card: Creative Sound Blaster Recon 3D ChampionRaid 1 for OS: 2 10,000 RPM 300GB VelociRaptors1TB 7200RPM data driveMonitor: Asus VG248QE 144Hz refresh, 1ms response, 80M:1 Contrast Ratio, 3D Vision supportSurround Sound: Logitech THX-certified Z-5300e

												This game is just awesome. It's kind of like blur but improved in every way.  The graphics are freaking awesome and the car destruction is very realistic for a video game. The car customization is very deep and detailed. The car selection is huge and so is the track selection. This is the farthest you can get from grinding. You can afford at least two good upgrades every time you win a race. Although making money is very easy, it doesn't ruin the game in any way. There is nothing that needs improving and again, this is the best racing game ever. Almost forgot, there is ale a death match mode. You drive around, picking up weapons, boosts, and health while trying to get the most kills. Simply awesome.

												Ok, this is a reworked version of my review so let me try this again.Gas Guzzlers Extreme is a car combat arcade racer, that type of genre that is usually missing in action when it comes to racing. There is a very high amount of cars that are parody versions of their real life counterpart (this is the only racer I know of that lets you race in a Reliant Robin), a ton of game modes,  maps, and weapons, as well as pick ups in races.. Graphics and performace wise, this game is very pretty. Really impressive damage models on the cars where they can have bullet holes, dented metal, and falling off parts. My only gripe is that there isn't that many people on the American servers, but hopefully those numbers will grow.Great game overall!

												Gas Guzzlers Extreme is a fast, furious, armed-to-the-teeth, trigger-happy shooter, shifted into top gear!


YouTube™ Video: ➜ A Quick Look @ 'Gas Guzzlers Extreme - Zombie Mode! 

			Views: 45		

			You can pick up the game from Steam here: http://store.steampowered.com/app/243800 A non-biased quick look @ 'Gas Guzzlers Extreme - Zombie Mode' - Gas Guzzlers Extreme is a fast, furious,...		

Take a white knuckle ride in this crazily addictive combat racing game that features a ton of vehicles, weapons, upgrades, on-track bonuses and environments. Gas Guzzlers Extreme is an exciting new twist on the car combat experience with the addition of furious team/clan combat battles. Players start out with low performance vehicles and soon work their way up to high-performance models, by earning money in a series of hi-octane races and arena battles. New game modes, tracks and vehicles are unlocked as players progress through the game. Along with developing their driving and fighting skills, players can spend their hard-fought cash, customizing their vehicle to match their clan members or pimping their ride for the road to glory! - Recommended!

number of helpful: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 6, 2016
												I am a big fan of racing games that have weaponry. Especially kart racers (woefully underrepresented on PC) do something to me. I f*cking love the inspired tracks, the brights colors, the high-speed racing and the tension the weapons add. This game has at least half of those, so needless to say I love it.This game doesn't need explaining, it's an arcade-y racer with guns and cars. You drive fast and shoot hard, it's exactly what you'd expect. The game has tons of content: massive amounts of cars and tons of weaponry, a large selection of maps and gamemodes (which up until now have all been really enjoyable) and a really extensive single-player campaign mode and some interesting mechanics. You basically have to climb the ladders of your competition pool until you have the most wins out of everyone in the cup, then you can enlist in the tournament and when you win that you get a more difficult competition pool where you'll do the same. Along the way you can attract sponsors by winning frequently, who will give you extra money for donning their ads while doing well in races. There's also random sponsor events which have large prize pools and team-based gamemodes. There's a lot of variation in the campaign mode and it's loads of fun, it also lasts for a really long time if you want a good dollar to gameplay ratio. This game is amazing man, whole-heartedly recommended. If you like guns, cars and arcade games, get this.

content:
Posted: March 4, 2016
												"I'm just trying to get to work, and out of nowhere some ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s start cutting me off, driving over the yellow line and dropping land mines everywhere."Gas Guzzlers Extreme is an intense multiplayer racing game with AI or human opponents. The current modes include a vanilla race, one with guns, and one where the slowest player is knocked out with each lap until no opponents remain. The graphics are so stunning they actually caused my computer to overheat, yet I experienced no lag, frame skipping or input delays even on the highest graphical setting. The customization for both your car AND your driver are at a somewhat simple level that does not overwhelm the casual player but still allows for a nice level of individuality. The HUD confused me at first, but I soon understood what meant what and was having fun. Until my computer overheated. 10/10, would fire a car-mounted shotgun again.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 6, 2016
												An amusing game shy of what it could have been but none the less a blast until rot of monotony sets in.Its another game where single player campaign is more an after thought as what works so well for multiplay is either muted by dumb AI or altogether missing.With that said you get a reasonable choice of cars, arms and upgrades to keep you interested along with if your into that sort of thing, NFS style cosmetic kit. The graphics are nice, the handling well done and a nice choice of tracks/arenas.If your looking for single player campaign action this may well fall short of your expectation but if your about fast quick pick up n play multiplay, then a romp you will have.It creeps into the thumbs up for me but not by much as while the multiplay makes this worth a buy, the normal price tag makes me wince when i weigh it up pound for pound.( While i wont change my original review or that of the DLCs because i do want people to consider the point im making before purchasing just the base game only, i dont want people to think this is a bad game as its most certainly not).

content:
Posted: March 4
												I AM RETRACTING EVERTHING I HAVE EVER SAID ABOUT THIS GAME, SO MANY BUGS AND ISSUESPositives -1. car racing and destruction is always fun and enjoyable2. customisation on all vehicles and unlocks and stickers and paint is good as well3. the locations and track are different and varied but not so much that it is a huge changeNegatives -1. the weapons do not do anything - 950 rounds from 2 miniguns into and enemy and the car is only at 50% damage even though you can get double damage it doesnt do anything. Shotguns are better and how?2. Ridiculous AI - i was 2 % off killing an enemy car and then he somehow went from 7th to 2nd on a straight in 3 seconds flat. - what?3. Your car does a full 180 degree spin when you hit a mine, or get stunned, or get hit once by a shotgun on straightThis game could be so good, but after the first hour or 2 you start to notice all the issues and bugs, and thats what is frustrating. Weak♥♥♥♥♥weapons, driving controls are tolerable but not great, unfair AI, wierd objectives. They did have a multiplayer but i guess they shut down due to lack of players. It may just be me that is having issues and bugs with this game but due to it being out for over 5 years i think they will always stay in the game - it was fun and enjoyable while it lasted. 6/10This has been my personal experience - if you don't like my review feel free to buy this game and play it for yourself. :)

content:
Posted: March 10, 2016
												Gas Guzzlers Extreme is a combat racing game, released 8 October 2013 for Microsoft Windows.[1] The game uses new PranaEngine™ developed by Gamepires. The purpose of the game is to dominate the tracks by racing and/or shooting your opponents. The game offers a total of 7 race types such as Classic Race, Power Race, Battle Race, Knockout, Capture The Flag, (Team) Deathmatch, and Last Man Standing. Gas Guzzlers Extreme includes 18 different vehicles and 12 weapons that can be used on 40 tracks and 8 different arena's.[2][3]
